swen221.util

Class WebServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • swen221.util.WebServer

  • public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
    The following class implements a very simple single threaded web server. A web server responds to HTTP requests over a socket by loading and transmitting back the requested file.
    Author:
    djp

      The following method is responsible for processing a single HTTP request command.
      static java.lang.String readRequest(java.net.Socket s)
      This method reads all possible data from the socket and returns it.
      void run() 
      static void send404(java.lang.String page, java.net.Socket s) 
      static void sendData(java.lang.String data, java.net.Socket s)
      Transmit file to socket in 1024 byte chunks.
      static java.lang.String stripHttpGetCommand(java.lang.String request)
      This method looks for the HTTP GET command, and returns that; or, null if none was found.
